div.p: Constellation Schools provides every child an opportunity to obtain an excellent education built on a foundation of character education for life long success.

div.h1: From the Desk of Principal Rotolo...

img.alt: Deborah Rotolo, Principal
img.title: Deborah Rotolo, Principal
img.style: float: right; margin-top: 5px; margin-left: 7px; left: 414px; width: 24%; height: 33%;

p.img: Constellation Schools: Westside Community School of the Arts is a K-8 school that opened in the Fall of 2007. While our school focuses first on a rigorous, quality academic education for its students, we also emphasize the “Arts” for our students. Students attending Westside Community School of the Arts are required to take no less than one hour of an art program daily. For our students in grades K-3, general music and visual arts are offered daily. Students in grade 4 participate daily in general music and visual arts with the opportunity to be a part of the orchestra as well. For our students in grades 5-8, the daily art programs offered are visual art, choir, band, and orchestra. While students in grades 5-8 must choose one program, they can also participate in two of the four programs. All students in grades K-8 have the opportunity to participate in our after school dance program. This exciting program offers ballet, pointe, jazz, hip hop, and contemporary dance. Lastly, various art clubs are offered after school from jazz band, honor’s choir, visual art club, along with private music lessons.

div.p: Westside Community School of the Arts offers small class sizes, a rigorous curriculum, a Positive Behavior Intervention System (PBIS), all built on a foundation of Character Education. The teaching staff is all highly qualified in their area of teaching, and all content is based upon the Ohio Content Standards which include Common Core Standards for reading and math. When our students graduate from our school, they have begun the process to become well-rounded, valuable members of society.
Welcome to Westside Community School of the Arts and we look forward to giving your child the education that they deserve in a positive learning environment.

p.br: SaferOH tip line will allow students and adults to anonymously share information with school officials and law enforcement about threats to student safety - whether that involved threatened mass incident or harm of a single student.

div.p: Constellation Schools: Westside Community School of the Arts does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding non-discrimination policies:
